content: Is nat_trans.naturality really a good simp lemma? In lean-homotopy-theory I proved that two compositions were equal where the proof was just by reassociating. But on one side naturality fired, and then after reassociating simp got stuck.
Maybe adding the _assoc version is the solution

I'm also wondering if the other direction of the rewrite might be easier. In cases where we have a natural transformation from the unit functor to something else (e.g. with Monad unit), creating that application of the unit functor is a pain but it's easy to eliminate
